intro: Aneilema woodii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces violet-blue or white flowers that bloom in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are usually rounded and velvety, providing a lush green backdrop to its vibrant blossoms. Aneilema woodii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
